Package honeyroasted.jype.system.solver

Interface TypeSolver

All Known Implementing Classes:
AbstractTypeSolver, ErasureTypeSolver, ForceResolveTypeSolver
public interface TypeSolver
This interface represents a class which can perform some logical process on a set of TypeConstraints and produce a solution. The simplest use would be to determine assignability between two TypeConcretes, but that is not required behavior. It just represents any sufficiently complex task to perform on some types.

Note that not every TypeSolver supports every TypeConstraint, see individual documentation to determine what constraints are supported. Also, each instance of a TypeSolver should remember all the TypeConstraints it has been provided. If a new set of TypeConstraints needs to be processed, a new instance of that TypeSolver should be created.

Implementations of TypeSolver should be thread-safe.

  • Method Details

    • constrain

      TypeSolver constrain(TypeConstraint constraint)
      Adds a TypeConstraint to this TypeSolver. Note that not all TypeSolvers support all types of TypeConstraints.
      Parameters:
      constraint - The TypeConstraint to add
      Returns:
      This, for method chaining

    • remove

      TypeSolver remove(TypeConstraint constraint)
      Removes a TypeConstraint from this TypeSolver.
      Parameters:
      constraint - The TypeConstraint to remove
      Returns:
      This, for method chaining

    • solve

      TypeSolution solve()
      Attempts to produce a valid TypeSolution from the TypeConstraints currently held in this TypeSolver. In general, implementations of this method should not throw exceptions, but rather report errors through a failed TypeSolution.
      Returns:
      The TypeSolution generated from this TypeSolver

    • constraints

      List<TypeConstraint> constraints()
      Returns:
      The List of TypeConstraints this TypeSolver is currently considering. The returned list may be a copy and/or immutable
